5. REDUCTION OF EXHIBIT SPACE

5.1 All request for reduction of exhibit space must be made in writing to the Organizer.
5.2 If the written request in clause 5.1 for reduction is received by the Organizer up until twelve (12) weeks before the Exhibition, the Organizer may in its absolute discretion, allow for the reduction, otherwise any written requests for reduction received by the Organizer after this period shall not be accepted.
5.3 The total Exhibition fee is payable in full even if the Organizer agrees for the reduction of the Exhibit space.

6. STAND BOUNDARIES
All Exhibition Materials must be kept within the agreed boundaries of the Exhibitor’s Exhibited spaced at all times. No Exhibitors may obstruct the gangways with the Exhibition Materials, nor may any such Exhibition Materials protrude from the boundaries of the Exhibit space. All distribution of literature must take place from within the boundaries of the Exhibitor’s Exhibit space and not in the gangways or any other area within the Venue. Any Exhibitor who continues to cause a nuisance or obstruction after notice has been given will be liable to have their exhibit space cleared by the Organizer at the Exhibitor’s own risk and expense.
7. WARRANTY
The exhibitor represent, warrants and undertakes that it is entering into this Agreements as principal and not as agent or nominee of any third party, and that the Exhibition Materials does not infringe or is likely to infringe any patent, trademark, copyrights and other intellectual property right of any party and agrees that in the event of any breach of representation, warranties and undertaking herein contained this Agreement may be terminated by the organizer. and the exhibitor shall indemnify the Organizer against any and all cost claims, demands, losses, termination due to the Exhibitor’s Breach.
8. SOUND LEVEL

The Cover must be provided by, and insurance company registered in the United Arab Emirates. Any policy of insurance obtained by the Exhibitor shall be acceptable only if complies with all the requirements of clause 12.1 and provided proof or certificate of such cover along with the policy terms and conditions are submitted to the Organizer at least two months prior to the commencement of build-up for the Exhibition.

(a)failure to pay for the total Exhibition fee or any related services within 7 calendar days written notice. (b)failure to set up its Exhibition Material in the Exhibit space as per the terms and conditions herein. (c)failure to own and maintain valid rights to make, use, perform, sell and display patented products, copyrighted works, trademarks and trade names; or (d) Violation of any patents, copyright or other intellectual property rights of another exhibitor or third party in any Exhibition Materials or ( E) involvement in the selling and/ or promotion of any counterfeit goods at the Exhibition including goods that, in the sole opinion of the Organizer, do not conform to the permitted show profile of the Exhibition.
13.2 In the event that the Organizer terminates this Agreement under Clause 13.1 the Organizer shall be entitled,

(1) Any and all, proceeding, claim, cost, damages or losses incurred of suffered by the Organizer by reason of breach by the Exhibition if this Agreement, any Regulation or any applicable law. or for any act or emission on the part of the Exhibitor whatsoever;
(2) Any and all customs, levy, tax fine or other payment the Organizer is called upon to pay any authorities on behalf of the Exhibitor in relation of the Exhibition.

19.ORGANIZER’S LIABILITY
The organizer will not be liable to the Exhibitor or any third party for any loss of profits or business, or for any direct or consequential loss or damage. The total liability of the Organizer to the Exhibitor arising out of or in connection with this Agreement will not exceed the amount of the Total Exhibition Fee Actually paid by the Exhibitor under this Agreement.
20. WAIVER
The Exhibitor waived any and all claims (of whatsoever nature) that it may have against the Organizer in anyway related to the storage. display or use of any exhibit/equipment in connection with the Exhibition, whether prior to, in the course of after its conclusion or after regular hours. The Exhibition, acknowledge and accepts sole and exclusive responsibility for the safety and security and storage of all the property and belongings of the Exhibitor at all times.
21. ENTIRE AGREEMENT
These Regulation together with the Space Allocation Agreement Constitute the whole agreement and understanding between the parties relating it is subject matter and supersedes any prior agreements whether in writing or oral, relating to such subject matter. No variation of this Agreement shall be effective unless made in writing and signed by each of the parties.
22. NOTICES
Any and all notices, demand and statements or documents of any kind which are desired or required to be given by one party to the other according to the provisions of the contract may be delivered by hand and upon successful completion of the transmission it sent by fax or electronic mail. Unless and until change by notice in writing given in accordance with the clause, the addresses, fax number and electronic mail id for the parties shall be as set forth in the Agreement.
23. CALENDAR
All dates and period will be determined by reference to the Gregorian Calendar.

10.3 The organizer shall issue official passes for the admission to the Exhibition and no other form for admission pass shall be valid. No Exhibitor shall be admitted to the Exhibition without producing to the gate official the Exhibitor’s pass being transferred or otherwise disposed of, it shall be immediately forfeited and no further pass will be issued in its place.

14.2 In the event of the Organizer becomes bankrupt or entering into liquidation (other than voluntary liquidation for the purpose of amalgamation or reconstruction) or having a receiver appointed this agreement will terminate forthwith and no further fees will be payable by the Exhibitor to the Organizer.

15. FORCE MAJEURE
A party shall not be in breach of this Agreement nor be liable for any failure or delay in performance of any obligations thereunder arising from or attributable to an event of Force Majeure ( with the exceptional of payment obligations) provided that such party has promptly notified the other party in writing of the nature and extent of the event of force Majeure causing its failure or delay in performance, If an event of Force Majeure occurs and written notice is serve then the Organizer may terminate this Agreement by written notice and the provisions of Clause 4.6 above shall apply. In the event of termination of this Agreement pursuant to Force Majeure, Neither party shall be liable to the other for any loss or damage of any nature or kind whatsoever suffered as a result of such termination.
16.ASSIGNMENT
The Exhibitor may not assign or transfer any its rights or obligations under the Agreement without the prior written approval of the Organizer may assign the whole or any part of the agreement to any third party without the consent of but with notice to the Exhibitions. The Agreement shall be binding on the successors -in tittle of the respective parties.
17. SEVERABILITY
If any term or conditions of the Agreement or the application thereof to any person or circumstances shall to any extent be invalid of unenforceable, the remainder of the Agreement, or application of such term or condition to persons or circumstances other than those as to which is it held invalid or unenforceable shall not be affected thereby and each term or condition of the contract shall be valid and enforceable
24. GOVERNING LAW & JURISDICTION
This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the local laws of the Emirates of Dubai and the federal laws of the UAE. Applied in the Emirate of Dubai. Any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be finally settled through the courts of Dubai.
